alert.note: Alert for Bartow; Chattooga; Floyd; Gordon (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 5:37AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Floyd, southwestern Gordon, central Chattooga and northwestern Bartow Counties through 630 AM EDT... At 537 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Fullerton, or 9 miles northeast of Cedar Bluff, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Rome, Calhoun, Summerville, Adairsville, Cave Spring, Kingston, Plainville, Shannon, Lyerly, Pinson, Lindale, Oostanaula, Tidings, Armuchee, Coosa, Berryton, Chattoogaville, Everett Springs, James H. Floyd State Park, and Holland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
